He is not looking in the direction where the photograph was captured. At the left hand side of the photograph, there are several flower pots which are placed above a stand.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This carte de visite shows a man dressed in Chinese robes and a bowler hat. The shopmark ‘Chia Peng Seng. Photographic Artist, Singapore’ is printed on the lower edge of the carte.

Chia Peng Seng ran a studio at 125 South Bridge Road, Singapore. In addition to photographs, he also painted portraits, and advertised himself as “the best and only French Enameller”.

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
